Articles.Content:
Hello everyone !

Tonight I was designing a rover, but I'm encountering a problem :

After a successful loading of my rover, I just have to make it move on 5 meters and... POOF ! Void. I destroyed the solar system. After pressing Alt+f12, I can read this error several times :

Quote

Infinity or NaN floating point numbers appear when calculating the transform matrix for a Collider. Scene hierarchy path "roverWheel1/model/roverWheel1/suspensionPivot/SteeringPivot/WheelPivot/wheel/collisionEnhancer"

I don't know where it come from. I have a several number of mods, so it will be difficult to list them all

but I tried making a similar probe with the same pieces on it, only the design is different and I don't get any error after few moves....

I'll give you some logs if you want to investigate :

KSP.log -> https://ufile.io/lwtb5

KSP_x64_Data's output_log.txt -> https://ufile.io/znt2w

And a screenshot of my GameData folder so you can see all the mods I'm using,

if the problem come from them : https://imgur.com/a/3cXPsXB

 

Btw, my rover has only stock, Infernal robotics and Magic Orbital Science parts.

Thanks for helping me

Edited May 5, 2018 by PrimoDev

Ok after a few tests it appears to come from Infernal robotics : when I removed all the part from this mod I don't get any errors

Still weird... Why would a mod like this one could cause the kerbol system to disapear after a few meter on surface and nothing happen when flying it in the air.

PrimoDev, meet the Kraken.  Kraken, PrimoDev. 

Now that you have been introduced, enjoy your stay.

Sorry, Krakens happen sometimes.
@Gargamel perhaps the Kraken is related to the https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mandelbrot_set somehow ...

Your best bet is a few sacrifices to the kraken. You will need a few more or less willing “volunteers”, a few grabber claws, and one mohole.

 

After doing that update to MM 3.0.7, remove anything MM config related, then reload. Contact your doctor if the problem persists more than 4 reboots.

Edited May 7, 2018 by Mark Kerbin

On 5/7/2018 at 5:35 PM, Mark Kerbin said:

Your best bet is a few sacrifices to the kraken. You will need a few more or less willing “volunteers”, a few grabber claws, and one mohole.

 

After doing that update to MM 3.0.7, remove anything MM config related, then reload. Contact your doctor if the problem persists more than 4 reboots.﻿

Well then, I will contact my doctor.. One interesting that I've noticed is the kraken seems to be attracted by infernal robotics (beta for now) only when I use the "hinge pivotron - flat" at "small -" size !

Then I will find a way to bypass the kraken using the size "small"

Edited May 10, 2018 by PrimoDev
In that case I’m going to take a wild guess and say that part is broken in the latest beta release. Go see if you can submit a bug report.
